intro: Koeleria kurdica, commonly known as the Kurdish goatgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to regions of the Middle East and Central Asia, including parts of Turkey, Iran, and Afghanistan. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky, or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as steppes and mountain slopes. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences with numerous tiny flowers, which are usually greenish or purplish in color. Koeleria kurdica is generally drought-tolerant and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
